gcci.text: With the H100 spot price holding near $3.21/hr, constrained supply and expanding capex plans point to sustained chip availability challenges through 2025.

gtpi.text: The drop of input token pricing to ~$1.25/1M underscores a rapid API price war and model efficiency race that continues to compress margins.

gagl.text: Kimi’s 120 TWh annual load highlights a growing grid strain that is accelerating baseload buildouts like nuclear while pressuring AI’s carbon footprint.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains buoyant but cautious, with token price deflation and rising hardware costs indicating bubble risk around unsustainable growth.
